cyclone.name: BARRY
cyclone.category: Potential Tropical Cyclone (not yet on SSHS scale)
cyclone.current_location: about 120 miles SE of the Mouth of the Mississippi River
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to drift west on Thursday, turn WNW Friday, then move northwest toward the central Louisiana coast this weekend
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central Louisiana coast, near or just west of Morgan City

weather_observation.watch_coast: Storm Surge Watch from the Mouth of the Pearl River to Intracoastal City, LA; Hurricane Watch from the Mouth of the Mississippi River to Cameron, LA; Tropical-Storm Watch from the Mouth of the Mississippi River to the Mouth of the Pearl River
weather_observation.impacted_coast: North-central Gulf Coast – mainly Louisiana coastline but impacts could extend west to the Upper Texas coast
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds possible; 59 % chance of 34-kt winds with earliest onset late Friday
weather_observation.storm_surge: Only minor surge expected on the upper Texas coast; main 3–6 ft surge threat remains east of Beaumont
weather_observation.rainfall: Periods of very heavy rain (4–8 in possible) beginning Friday night through Saturday could cause flash flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Freshwater flooding of access roads and possible river rises that could disrupt port and refinery logistics
